website_summaries.verdict: If you love the idea of listening to your favorite music on the go, but you haven’t found an ultra-lightweight Bluetooth headset that’s comfortable enough, it’s time to give the SoundBuds Slim a try.
pros: Control your music via integrated microphone voice controls
cons: Although 7 hours is more than enough time to hit the gym and return home, some users may prefer a longer battery life

website_summaries.verdict: The SoundBuds Slim Bluetooth earphones are hard to beat for the price, especially if you're not a stickler for sound quality.
pros: The SoundBuds Slim are inexpensive but don't look or feel cheap
they fit and work reliably well with sound decent enough for their price
a carrying pouch is included and the buds adhere to each other magnetically
cons: Bass is a little bloated (loose) and the treble has a touch of harshness, particularly at higher volumes
other online-only companies are selling virtually identical products

customer_reviews.title: Worked for only 5 weeks. Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and Short lived!!!!! Do not buy! Ordered these earbuds on April 12th. They probably arrived here around the 15th. The window for return was May 12th. One week after the return date expired, on May 19th, the sound volume started turning itself down on it's own. Today, May 24th, the earbuds would not turn on despite the fact that they had still had a good charge two days ago. Now they are plugged in to charge, in case that was the problem, but it has been two hours and still the light that should come on, to indicate that they are charging, has not come on. Very disappointed in these and in this company.
customer_reviews.author: Ukiacat

customer_reviews.title: I finally purchased another brand at a big box store for $25 that sound much better and appear to be built a lot sturdier
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair in September that worked find until January...then they stopped powering on. After reading other reviews I found a way to finally get them to come on by plugging and unplugging the power cord multiple times while holding the power button down. I contacted Anker and they sent me a replacement pair, which lasted about a month before they started shorting out, dropping the Bluetooth connection and intermittently not charging. I finally purchased another brand at a big box store for $25 that sound much better and appear to be built a lot sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Geek

customer_reviews.title: Two bad pairs so far and one previously worn!!!
customer_reviews.text: First pair came in and would not charge. Worked until the battery died but would not charge after using multiple chargers and cables. Contacted Anker customer support and they sent me a replacement unit after I mailed them back the defective unit. The replacement earbuds they sent were previously used and had earwax in one of the earbuds. I then discovered only one side of the earbuds worked. So now I have to send back yet another pair back to Anker and hope that I can get my money back. What a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: These aren't good for extreme exercising. They just don't hold up.
customer_reviews.text: I'll start out saying their customer support is great, But!! Their product isn't. My first pair I purchased quit working right at 30 days. Anker sent a replacement pair really quick. The 2nd pair lasted about 37 days before they failed also. They refunded my money without issue. Unfortunately I gave these headphones a 3rd chance, and less than 10 days these have now failed. They won't take a charge. I use these a lot.. Usually three to four hours a day under heavy exercising while running. I can only assume these aren't water resistant and can't handle any sweat getting near them before they short out. I recommend going with another brand if you use these during exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Ouch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service. Good Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are reasonable quality and well priced. If based solely on the headphones, I'd probably rate them a four-star. The sound is not hi-fi, but it's fine for everyday listening, audiobooks, phone calls, etc. Battery life is also fine. I've given these headphones five stars because of the excellent customer service. 17 months into owning the headset, I started to lose sound in one earbud. I contacted Anker through the Amazon platform; they sent out a new set of headsets immediately. Could not be more pleased. Will continue to work with this company in the future. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Skidtz

customer_reviews.title: Love the product but disappointed in the durability
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Anker earbuds were a gift, and lasted me a little over a year with every day use before they died. I was looking to replace them, and liked the shortness of cable compared to other brands. I also loved them for sound quality, noise cancellation, and long battery life. Until this week that is... I purchased this pair in February and have used them regularly. When I went to use them yesterday and one of the earbuds seems to have cut out though. I’m disappointed that they aren’t durable and as much as I have loved Anker bluetooth earbuds, I might have to try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: wanderen

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Rugged!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but I am making an exception for these ears buds. The durability of these things deserve a good review. I have the first pair of these and still going nearly three years later. I've used them so much the buttons are worn flat. I lost them under a customer's house during the winter & recoverd them about two months later. I cleaned, charged & they are working fine. They have survived everything! The rain, power washing moisture & grime, mowing grass every week, riding utv's, etc. I have now torn the outer jacket in the cord & still working flawless. I definitely recommend these things to anyone who want a rugged pair of ear buds!
customer_reviews.author: Electricman

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for sleeping so sound quality isn't first on my list but these do sound pretty good. Not too much bass on s low level but might get more if the volume is higher. Battery life is the most important thing for me and these last 10-11 hours on continuous play. They aren't the most comfortable earphones out there so I wouldn't reccomend them for sleeping unless you have a soft pillow and ears that aren't too sensitive. These would be really good for long airplane flights. Noise cancellation is really good and I don't here much other than the music. For the price these are worth grabbing.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Fashionable, Excellent Quality, Great Gift Idea!
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the best product and exceeded my expectations when I got it. Excellent design and quality, affordable price that I can’t stop recommending this to my co workers and friends. I first tried this earbud from my husband then I screamed and ask him to get one for me. The magnet helps for secure the earbuds on your neck area and IT ACTUALLY LOOKS FASHIONABLE! The package also included accessories: a clip to help adjust the length of the wire, and a clip to attached to your shirt. It’s all about the details. so happy with my purchased! I love it. Thanks for Anker for such wonderful product <3
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: If you want these for running or other "in motion" activities = I say Meh. otherwise great for the gym, commuting, walking etc. 1. The cord doesn't go over ear so all the weight is pulling on the plugs. This makes them more prone to come lose and worst of all, the cord transmits noise with every bounce. 2. The monitors stick out of your ear A LOT. OK if you're just walking around the house but impossible to use under a helmet or hat. Putting the helmet on or off either jams them in your ears or knocks them out. Or both. Sound is good though ; )
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: I expected better sound quality...
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are well made and typical of Anker's reputation for quality. Battery life is excellent and the magnetic backs are awesome for keeping them around your neck for convenience and pack them away in a small untangled footprint. I SOOOO wanted them sound as good also.. Unfortunately while not terrible, the sound quality is just a "meh". Weak bass and kind of fuzzy buzzy highs. Also the mic is too weak to use for a conversation on a train or plane where there is significant background noise. I will keep them as a backup, but have rotated back to my previous buds for my daily commuting. (Ansion Bluetooth Wireless Sports 4.1 Lightweight HD Noise Cancelling In-Ear Headphones with Mic)
customer_reviews.author: Roberto

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit well / FIXED; Read
customer_reviews.text: I liked them until I realized that they dont fit well at all. I tried the different to and earwing sizes but no matter what and how I tried to do it, they wouldnt seal properly to make them sit still. Couldn't stand that and had to give to a friend. 2 stars EDIT (5 stars): After I complained, anker almost immediately contacted us and even way after the warranty expired, they were forgiving and gave us a free upgraded model with ear hooks which solved the problem. Beyond satisfied with their responce, they did more than necessary seeing how late my complaint was. No return needed. 10/10, would buy again. Thanks Anker
customer_reviews.author: revelation

customer_reviews.title: Good Warranty coverage
customer_reviews.text: I really liked my Anker headphones when new. They sounded great and were perfect for workouts. However, one side stopped working today. My previous Anker products were good, these don't make the cut. Stay away from these headphones. I am disappointed that I will have to try the warranty. I will update if the warranty is useful. EDIT: Anker came through . They provide prepaid shipping to return the defective headphones and sent me a new pair. Updated to 4 stars. Hopefully they will last longer, but I am glad they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Dollar Conscious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: These last a while
customer_reviews.text: Actually impressed at how long these lasted. An entire top to bottom cleaning day worth. I didn't want to wear my big headphones since I was going to be doing a lot of cleaning and sweating. I had to wrap these with a rubber band behind my neck as the chord was dangling and in my way, but that's about all the complaint there is. Not much noise cancelling with these as I heard my doorbell a few times, but then again I was listening to a book and not music. But these, for doing some cleaning and working out, are great!
customer_reviews.author: Yoli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light weight, comfortable, long battery life, reasonable price, good warranty Cons: Sounds very tinny. I use it mainly for running and I listen only to podcast. So the sound quality is "ok". But I can't imagine using these to listen to music. 5-28 Update: I'm upgrading this review to 4 star for two reasons: Excellent customer support and a better performing replacement set. After I posted my original review, within 24 hours, Anker contacted me diligently to try to "make good" on the product's promise, up to and including sending me a replacement set for free. This second set is sounding better than the first, and I'm happy. Their exemplary customer service is just the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Just say no to 2 amp chargers
customer_reviews.text: Used for running 3-4 times per week for several months, they're still doing fine. Good battery life, audio is acceptable, sweat resistance is really good. I've been careful about charging these using only my computer USB (500ma). I think I fried a couple other ones by using the 2A charger that came with my phone. Hoping these will work a long time...
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: best costumer service ever!
customer_reviews.text: after a year of using the product I had a problem with pairing the headphones, I contacted Anker's customer service and they answered right away. Without the need to prove anything they provide me with a new set of headphone and sent it to me a week later. They did a follow up along the way to make sure that everything is going well and they were super polite and professional. Considering the relatively low price of the product I was really surprised to experience this high level of service, thanks a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Tamar L

customer_reviews.title: Killer battery!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because they no longer sell the old sound buds. I wish I’d gotten these sooner because they truly have a better battery (or better battery management). I can go all day without needing to stop and charge which is great because I like to listen to music during my commute and while I work out. Sound is good but I’m not really qualified to comment. Mic quality is good enough for phone calls. I don’t like the volume/ pause remote or the voice over “low battery” but I’m willing to overlook that.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Wireless Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Before these earbuds, I had Jlabs Epic Sport Bluetooth and Jaybird X3 Bluetooth earbuds. I've had these Anker earbuds for about a year. Overall, I prefer these Anker ones. The battery life is great - I can probably get 8 hours of usage on a single charge and the battery is still good even though they're about a year old now. Sound quality is great especially the bass. I find these Anker earbuds to be really comfortable too and they don't fall out when I skateboard. I wish they were a bit slimmer so that they don't poke out of the ear as much though.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the market for a pair of lightweight bluetooth headphones for awhile so I decided to take a chance on these. We love Anker products in our house and at this price, it was a no-brainer. They are definitely lightweight, sound is great for a small set of headphones, they are comfortable in my ears, the controls are easily accessible and they are very easy to pair with bluetooth devices. We were so impressed with these headphones, we immediately bought a 2nd pair for my wife. If you're looking for a good pair of headphones for yard work, running, or just working quietly at home, these are for you! 5 stars all the way around!
customer_reviews.author: TheOsterlohs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these headphones for almost 2 years now and they still work great. The Sound quality, is pretty good but it could be a little better. The battery life, on average I get about 4-5 hours. They do not cancel much noise but I prefer that. They stay in your ears well but if you do a lot of running I recommend getting the "anker soundbud curve". One of the things that I like most about them is the magnet, it keeps them around my neck pretty well when I am not using them. They are an all around Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: John & Lindy

customer_reviews.title: STEAL FOR THE PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: An amazing fit, comes with interchangeable ear pieces. They never become lose or fall out. There is a clip to keep the cord from jumping during workouts. And the sound, deep bass without hurting, smooth, crisp sound. Blocks out almost all outside noises. For the price this is an absolute steal. A small carrying case as well to keep from damaging while in my pocket. I love these things. The battery life last all week and I listen quite often. I'll purchase more as a gift for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Damien Paredes

customer_reviews.title: Just OK...Little More $ Will Go A Lot Further for Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: They are ok...always perplexed by emphatic reviews for mediocre items that scream it's the best 'item" ever? Headphones sound quality is fine. It's not the worst but it's absolutely not the best -especially for price. My suggestion is to wait and save-up a few more dollars and then get a nicer pair of headphones, you'll thank your future self. *Check trustworthy websites for headphone reviews in roughly the same price range (maybe a little more since you took my advice and saved a few dollars) and find a better sound quality pair.
customer_reviews.author: Brycen Downes

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Great customer support.
customer_reviews.text: As much as tried this headphone I felt it isn't for me. It’s okay to use when seated or not moving too much, but I tried to run with it, and gave up due to constant need to reposition the earpieces. I got contacted by Anker Customer Support after giving my impressions on this earbuds, and they kindly offered my me a different model to try showing Anker is serious when it comes to their products and also customer satisfaction, and that's why I love Anker products. Power banks, wireless charger, car charger, etc. I have them all.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: average headphone
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this headphone because i loved the anker soundbud curve. the curve had great sound. i thought this slim would be similar except in a lower profile. the sound was not as good as the curve. it is smaller and more portable but not worth the sound downgrade. this sits while i still use the soundbud curve.
customer_reviews.author: dakbrar

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought many cheap, and some high-priced buds before, and these have been the best bluetooth buds I've owned. Decent price, good sound quality with nice bass. Battery life is about 4 hours average before needing charge (at full volume), which isn't much when using it for daily commute, but I have plenty of time to charge these up while at work so it's not a big issue for me. They have already outlasted most of my wired and bluetooth buds I've had over the years. For the price, these are an great pick-up.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the money with flaws
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for what you pay. I've tried a bunch of Anker headphones in the pat few months an they've all been pretty good quality but with one huge flaw..... they all have a disturbing white noise static whenever its on. Tested them on 2 separate Note 10+ and iPhone 7 Plus. Even the higher end models like their true wireless models do the same thing. Must be an Anker Soundcore thing. It really comes down to if you're sensitive to it or if you'll get used to it. I'm okay with it but it bothers my wife more.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Snap, Crackle, Pop. Half the Quoted Battery Life. Just adequate.
customer_reviews.text: I've now used these for about six months of active gym use and casual use while working. My biggest problem with these is that they snap crackle and pop FREQUENTLY. No matter what you are doing or what device. I can't get through a single song without some crackling, whether they are connected to my laptop, my phone, or my desktop PC. The battery life for me has only ever been maybe half what is advertised. It lasts about 5 hours through the week. But they do work. They're just adequate. The quality is about what you would expect from any other ear buds. The price is reasonable for the quality. But that snap crackle and pop is really obnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: They're OK
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is fine, when they connect correctly. For some reason I have to "forget" and then re-pair them with my phone in order for them to connect as HD audio. Subsequent pairings without a "forget device" in between result in them pairing with non-HD audio, and then I get skips and crackling. The battery life also seems to drop much faster the lower the remaining life. It took several hours of use to get down to about 25-30%, then they died on me about 10 minutes after that.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these since 2017. They are great. I bought them so I could watch videos on my small device without my children hearing, lol! But now with school online I use them while I'm teaching. I barely ever have to charge them, they last so long! My son ordered a pair as well, and they've been great. They have different size rubber insert parts, which is great for me because I have very small ears. They are also the only ones I've ever had that stay put in my ears. And I can't believe I've had them for 3 years!
customer_reviews.author: Alizabeth32

customer_reviews.title: Defective - returning
customer_reviews.text: Returning these as they are defective out of the box and will not change tracks on any phone. I've bought a lot of Anker products, not sure why I keep doing it as about 1/3rd of purchases are either DOA are fail quickly. And sure, you get an 18 month warranty and they're happy to refund-replace but there's clearly a quality issue across the board. Sound quality for these was ok for the price, pity they didn't actually work fully.
customer_reviews.author: LFP

customer_reviews.title: Good first pair of bluetooth earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned these now for over 3 weeks. I use them pretty much every day at work and a couple times a week while running. I think they are a great value for the cost. They sound good. They don't fall out of my ears. I have no issues connecting to my Google Pixel 1st gen. I haven't used $100+ Bluetooth earbuds to compare, but I can tell you that I am happy with my purchase here. I haven't completely drained the battery, so can't comment on exact battery life, but I am also the type that has to keep all my devices charged at all times. I've probably gone 3 hours of continuous use.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Anker products trust me
customer_reviews.text: Quits taking a charge after a few weeks. This was my third one. Anker products are all bad. I’ve had charging cords, headphones, external battery packs and a few of these. All BAD. Put your money towards something else I’m telling ya I’ve tried all this stuff. Bad products and they used to have good customer service but now they don’t even have that. Go with another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: I’m not a moron & I tell the truth

customer_reviews.title: excellent value, excellent product
customer_reviews.text: We have bought 3 of these in our household. Everyone is very happy with this product. Great sound, great battery life, super neat magnetic feature to keep from losing them once you take them out. Wish I had gotten a pair years ago! Really enjoying doing my chores and errands with these in! I can go outside to do chores and have phone inside and signal works still. Haven't used for phone calls yet as that was not my purpose in getting them so can not review that aspect yet.
customer_reviews.author: 4krob

customer_reviews.title: Reliably decent earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These are the 6th pair of bluetooth earbuds that I've purchased over the past 5 years. They're also the best wireless earbuds I've found. Granted, I don't spend a lot of money. I use these mostly for listening to audio sources while the rest of the household is sleeping. They're not going to sound as good as a decent pair of over-the-ear cans. But they do sound pretty darn good, and never fail to connect to my bluetooth devices. These are the first pair of bluetooth buds in my collection that always make connection. They are light-weight, don't fall out of my ear balls, and hold a charge. The other 5 pair are in various drawers around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Craige10

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, comfortable, cheap and sound great!
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid runner and I purchased these to replace my 5 yr old Jaybird X2 earbuds. Sound quality is about the same as the X2 which cost 3 times as much. These little Ankers are more comfortable and stay in better than Jaybirds. They pair easily sand quickly. Two things would make them better. First, and app to tune them would be great. It’s only a matter of time until all companies provide an app to tune their earbuds. Second, a piece to shorten the wire so it doesn’t flop around. You can probably buy these separately on Amazon. Build quality is great and for $25, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: KRS

customer_reviews.title: Anker earbuds always great but thety don't sync volume with phone
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few pairs of Anker earbuds over the years. All have been good. These are just as good as the other pairs with one minor annoyance; the volume buttons on the earbuds don't sync with my Note 9's volume. It's the first time I've seen this. The workaround is to max out your phone's volume if you want to use the inline volume buttons. It works for me but one star deducted because they don't work as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheManDRH

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy. Affordable and better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't gotten them fully wet yet, but so far so good. I wish they were a little louder also, but other than that they are pretty much great. The quality of sound is honestly better than I had expected, and they tend to stay in place, I bought these for the gym and running so as I continue to test them I will update more here, so far so good, great fit as all in-ear headphones they tend to reduce outside noise which is great in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Haruka-J

customer_reviews.title: I washed em and they still work!
customer_reviews.text: I just put these through the wash cycle in a pair of pants and they still work. I've owned this a month and use these while cycling and I sweat a lot. It also rains here a fair bit when cycling, we have rain forests.. Anyway for the price they are great. If they had a smaller profile they would be less prone to wind deflection. The result of sound under these conditions is less than ideal. I usually just turn up the volume. At times I have taken a few phone calls with these and it was effortless. This seems to a durable product with good quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Quit working within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Headphones started losing charge. After a couple of months I had to charge each time I used them (usually for about an hour workout). Then they started only lasting 30 minutes. Ultimately they wouldn't turn on. Worked with customer support chat from Amazon for 45 minutes only to be told I need to call the manufacturer. What a waist of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: These make for a nice bargain set of buds
customer_reviews.text: These make for a nice bargain set of buds. Please note, that the instructions say to hold the button for 1 second to turn them on, but for me, it was closer to 5 seconds. I thought they we're DOA due to this. I'm sure the sound isn't as great as more expensive ones, but for walking, jogging and working out, they get the job done, don't look bad, and fit well. I can't speak to long term durability, but the weak link in most earbuds is the wire connection to the device, and this being wireless, eliminates that area.
customer_reviews.author: B. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I am working a Project from 7 AM to & 7 PM for which I need to be continuously on a conf call. I have used these for 9 strait days for 10-11 hours a day (need to recharge once during the day about 9 hours in). No Issues. When you turn them on it states the power level, and you can see the power level on the menu bar of your phone. There are 4 sets of earbud sizes, clip for shirt, short micro USB, and a nice velvet like pouch for storage.
customer_reviews.author: dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great product and amazing company to buy from
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product. Moreover, I would like to thank this company for his excellent customer service and integrity. After a year, my headphones stopped working. I contacted Anker Direct and they promptly responded and replaced them. They followed up with me after replacing them to see if everything was ok. I could not have asked for more. Thank you Anker Direct for all your help. I am very happy to be part of the Anker Direct family.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Great until 6 months later...
customer_reviews.text: Originally I would haven given 5 stars overall. They pair perfectly with my phone and the sound is great for a $25 pair of earbuds. I loved mine and my son was using them, so I bought him a pair. Unforutately, after 6 months, the right side of his stopped working. I'm seeing this complaint repeated in some of the reviews. What I would love is a replacement pair or credit for another pair becuase we really do like them and typically Anker has decent quality merch. Any chance for a replacement???
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Stickles

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth headphone technology has come a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I bought another brand's headphones very similar to these a few years ago and HATED them. Battery life was terrible, the earbuds were heavy and uncomfortable, they didn't sync well with video, and there was lots of microphonic sound when touching the cord. After about a week of use I can confirm these headphones have none of those problems thanks to advancements in technology. For the price, these are a great set of headphones. The magnetized earbuds are a great touch! I can recommend if you are looking for headphones you can cook or clean the house in.
customer_reviews.author: Elise C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice slim form factor, nothing bulky about these.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of SoundBuds from Anker, and I want to clarify that I'm a huge fan of Anker products. The first Soundbuds were great until they broke (two different pairs, just split during normal use, the case in the headphone is very fragile.) These are great, super small form factor that are nothing like most bulky bluetooth earbuds. They seem to be really well made and don't appear to have the same potential for coming apart. Have used heavily for a week and all good so far. Innovative design as the power and the charging apparently are on the mic control, not on the earbud, saving a lot of weight up there.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For their relatively nominal cost, this Anker headset is a great buy for someone looking for a convenient way to listen to music on the go. The build quality is surprising given the cost, as well. Full disclosure: my first pair of these shorted out after about 10 months of consistent use. A quick email to Anker's support line got a replacement pair sent over, which I am currently using. Overall great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Bechtel

customer_reviews.title: Updated review
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Anker sent me new earbuds and they are just as awesome but with good battery, I recommend this product and this company Sound quality is great but they get 3 stars because the battery barely lasts more than 3 hours and I've had them for a little over month. It sucks that the battery life is so bad because I really like these earbuds, but I can't use them for more than 3 hours without them dying. For that reason I wouldn't recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: A Company that Stands Behind its Products
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in the Fall of 2018. The earbuds were easy to pair, solid audio quality, and had a great battery life for the price. Recently, the mesh in one of earbuds caved in and made the volume weaker in one ear. Fortunately, these earbuds have an 18 month warranty and I was able to easily get a new replacement set sent out to me free of charge after going to Anker's website. The customer service was excellent and hassle free in terms of getting a new earbud set mailed to me. I will definitely have no problem buying more products from this company in the future seeing how they stand behind them.
customer_reviews.author: Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Total trash.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are trash. Picked them up because Kinja Deals said they were well reviewed, but they hardly work at all. When connected to my Pixel XL they only have a working range of about 2 feet. If I hold my phone in my hand at my chest the work fine, but the minute i try to put my phone in my pocket the audios starts to skip constantly. What is the point of a pair of headphones if you can't put your phone in your pocket? I'm very disappointed with this purchase, even for the low price. Will not be buying headphones from Anker again.
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely comfortable for my ears and sound much better than I expected. They aren't amazing but they're better than sound I've personally experienced with soundPeats or Mpow in the under 50$ range. I'm sure they're not the only good earbuds out there but for 20 or 30$ I'm extremely satisfied with the purchase. 2 month update: Still awesome. I love these more and more. They are so comfortable and they sound great for the price. Or even twice the price. I've bought 3 pairs now to give as gifts. They feel much higher quality than all the other headphones I've seen for under $50.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 pair and I use them almost every day. Mostly just as headphones. I don't normally use for phone calls. They don't last an entire 8 hour work day, but I charge one while I'm using the others. I work in a room with 6 other people; these make it easy to block out conversations so I can concentrate on my work. Music and videos sound really great. the ear piece fits the best out of numerous other earbuds that I've bought or tried. the cord is light weight and works well enough to exercise with them and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: very nice cheap pair of wireless earbuds, but...
customer_reviews.text: I got these mostly because they were really cheap and were wireless. First issue I really noticed was that the bluetooth cut out a bunch if going than a foot of open air. I usually carry my phone in my front left pocket, if I turned my head to the right, the earbuds would cut out. Or if I was wearing a heavy coat, the earbuds would cut out. Granted, I bought these in September 2017, so they've held up very well for the price! The right earbud just started coming apart the other week... guess when my 18month warrenty expired?...March
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: For $25 - Exceeding expectations by far.....
customer_reviews.text: Recently I purchased an inexpensive pair of Bluetooth earbuds for yard work and exercising and they were with horrible sound. I then did a bit more research and came up with this and for twenty-five bucks, they are wildly exceeding my expectations. The sound is wonderful and crisp and these earbuds sit in the ear comfortably. The sound is distorted if they are pushed too firmly in the ear canal. The noise isolation is also a pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ellis

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Now don't get me wrong these are no bose sound sport or anything like those, but they are a very nice alternative that is very inexpensive. These sound amazing when compared to some more expensive options. I absolutely love Anker products. There has not really been anything of theirs that I have not liked. The only thing I would have to say negative about these is the base seems to be a little muffled like the treble even could be off a bit, but I can deal with this excellent price. You will not go wrong with buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Keanan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my review. I have to say I am very impressed with Anker, after my review and concern regarding the battery, they reached out to me themselves and provided a replacement set of buds. There are not very many companies, that have that kind of service...5/5 for that alone! The new buds arrived today and are charging! Purchased these on Amazon in March 2017 for my golf bag to listen to music while hitting golf balls.....by November 2017 they will not hold a charge at all.I must have used for a total of 5 hours in 6 months, charged them every couple of weeks. I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: New / different headset is much better
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is not what I expected from Anker, a company I have had exceptional experience with for other products. Music sounds tinny (thin, twangy, tilted to the high end). I would look elsewhere for a headset. Anker customer support was very responsive and sent me a different headset. It is a different model and it sounds much better. I don't know if the issue that I had was specific to the product or a faulty unit. What I do know is that Anker customer service is rock solid, and I have had great success with other products that they make.
customer_reviews.author: TroutBum

customer_reviews.title: Good range, comfortable selection of tips
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good range, comfortable selection of tips, solid balance of treble and bass. Handy magnet mechanism. Cons: As someone else already mentioned, battery indicator is unreliable. One moment the phone reports headphone battery as mostly full, then immediately drops to zero and starts beeping with the low battery indicator. Also, after a period of use (sometimes minutes, sometimes two+ hours), audio begins to stutter and crackle. Device must be restarted to restore normal audio quality.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: So far, they are excellent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on the reviews. I also purchased a pair of $60 bluetooth earbuds from a competitor. These sound much better, are easy to connect, have minimal white noise, and fit well for my little ear. I like the form factor, they feel good. They aren't bulky or heavy. I've had no connectivity issues. For $20 they sound amazing. The battery is good. 6 hours isn't quite as good as 8, but for now, it will work. They charge quickly so it's okay. We will see how the battery holds up over cycles, but for $20 I've made much worse purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: **EDITED** Died after 3 months. Anker Customer Service was excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Not even three months after purchase and the unit died. First the indicator light stopped functioning and now they won't charge and will not power on at all. Anker customer service refunded me very promptly and recently sent me a free pair to keep. I've used them a couple times with no issues. Great Service from Anker.
customer_reviews.author: Flyeagle223

customer_reviews.title: For voice, very good. For music, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few months now. I was using them mainly for phone calls and instructional videos. For that purpose, these are really good. Clear audio on both ends of the call, and comfortable to wear. Lately, I've been listening to more music, and the deficiencies are showing. There is almost no bass response. The music doesn't quite sound tinny, but it's close. Are they still a good value? For the price, yes, if you don't listen to music much, or don't care about the fidelity. If the music is important, you may want to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: PapaCliff

customer_reviews.title: Updated - Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a year of use. The plastic casing on the controls portion of the headphones was poorly assembled or manufactured from the beginning and I think that is why they eventually stopped working. Headphone portion feels and looks high quality, but the controls casing was poor at best. Will probably go with a different brand as a replacement. Update 9/15/18 - Anker customer service contacted me to offer a replacement. I accepted and received the new unit. The construction was stellar this time and the control casing looks perfect. Increased to 4 stars for the great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I love these, they block out a good amount of noise, good clear volume, they last all day at work, I get 16-20 hours before needing to charge them. They charge quickly, like an hour and they are good to go. They are comfortable to wear, have 3 sizes for the earpiece and are easy to change. Can't use them while they are charging, but that's pretty typical. Bluetooth is good, I can get about 25 feet away from my phone before it starts to lose connectivity. They have a clip and a thing to adjust the length of the cord connecting them.
customer_reviews.author: AJara

customer_reviews.title: Ankers sent a Free Replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds, I really liked the set up, but after a month while working out, just stopped working. :( UPDATE: I was contacted by Anker to send me a new earbuds. Very kind of them to replace my broken one. I just received the new one and will see if the new one holds up longer and better. Just by them replacing my old one, deserves 5 stars for customer service. Thanks Ankers for the replacement, I really appreciate it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Jaguar

customer_reviews.title: The best cheap bluetooth earphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using them for quite a long time now and they are an essential company to me. The noise cancellation is good and the voice quality is clear. They can be customized for people with different fir to their ears. The battery backup is pretty good. Problems: The flap that covers the charging port never closes properly after the first charging session. There is a very faint background noise like water dripping if nothing is being played.
customer_reviews.author: Anshika

customer_reviews.title: These were great earbuds, very comfortable in my ear as I ...
customer_reviews.text: These were great earbuds, very comfortable in my ear as I walked on my treadmill. I have not used these a great amount of time since purchasing them and I'm an adult who takes care of items. I purchased my earbuds in April and this weekend I noticed they were not charging when plugged in. I tried to use them today but they wouldn't work, so I plugged them in again and tried to charge them but they will no longer charge. The earbuds are only 4 months old!!!! Even for the affordable price, there is no reason the earbuds should stop charging already. Very disappointed in this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K. Popp

customer_reviews.title: Good if you never move, airtight seal to ear canal.
customer_reviews.text: Fits air tight in ear canal. Because of this if you move the sound changes. Another downside is any movement of the wire, any touch at all, is amplified to the earbuds. These will NOT work for anything where your moving your head, which changes the seal in your ear canal, or moving enough to move the wire. If you sit still and never look around these are fantastic! Of your active, run away as fast as you can.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFrom-a-FlatState

customer_reviews.title: Stays in my ears while running!
customer_reviews.text: I have small ears, so my earphones fall out sometimes. The flap on these headphones is super effective, much better than the loop around the back of the ears which can vary in success depending on your ear shape. The earphones stay in my ears while running and have really a good sound that does block out a lot of noise. They're very comfy too. I don't think I ever had discomfort wearing them for 2-3 hours. I'm not sure if they truly last 10 hours, but with how much I use them, I haven't had to charge often enough that it is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gee

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and battery life, they seal out outer noise so beware of that.
customer_reviews.text: Great sound considering the price. Way more bass than I was expecting. I'm using them with a Pixel 2XL phone and pairing and use is perfect. Battery life seems to be fantastic. One concern is that these really seal out everything. I use them for running and I am considering finding something else that allows some leakage so I can hear other trail runners and cars and whatnot. It's also a little weird having them move in my ear the tiniest bit even though they are sealed. It amplifies the shifting noise and is pretty loud. So, maybe not ideal for running but I'm not going to ding them any stars for that. They do what they do perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good For The Price But Lasted 19 Months Before Issues
customer_reviews.text: Up until today, the only issue I had was the charger port cover fell off and would not stay attached. Today, the right side has less than 50% volume output compared the the left side. Unfortunately I purchased 19 months ago and the Anker warranty on headphones is 18 months. These headphones were a good purchase for the price but I did expect them to last longer. My main use is at the office, on a plane etc. I do not use them for running or during any other activities that would damage them.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected for the price!
customer_reviews.text: LPT: Always look for "Amazon's Choice" and "Editorial recommendations". There, you'll get educated, detailed, and very helpful information. These are light weight (easy to forget your wearing them) comfortable, non slipping, and have a great sound! I was amazed at the high quality of this purchase for the price. Would be happy to recommend these to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Matt2337

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great and Anker will stand by product if under warranty.
customer_reviews.text: My review is more about Anker customer service, than the actual product. My original pair of headphones lasted about a year before the volume control started to fail. They sent me a replacement pair because it was within the 18 month factory warranty. That replacement pair, however, was faulty. The right earbud was only about half as loud as the left side. I reached out again and explained the situation, and their customer service rep sent me another replacement set. Those are working out great. Very pleased all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: John N.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor battery
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disapointed in the battery life. I would have returned if they were still within the period. I rarely use them so by the time I figured out I wasn't leaving them running but rather the battery just doesn't last it was too late. Audio quality is great and the magnetic buttons are handy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: They last!
customer_reviews.text: I grew tired of wireless earbuds that didn't have enough battery capacity to last for a bike ride. These will last through a week of 45 minutes morning workouts and extended rides on the weekend. I rarely have to charge them more than once a week. It did take me a few calls to get used to answering from the headphone buttons, not from the phone screen or my FitBit (either of those two methods requires popping out the earpiece and holding the phone to the ear)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Five month since purcahse, love them so far. Anker does have good cusomer service, and great products. I love how they don't flash annoyingly when they are in use, they do flash when they are not paired. Great magnetic earphones, stronger than my Phaiser BHS-730 and Nekteckones. The battery is also long lasting. I use these to mostly watch shows. I also listen to some Electropop like Grimes when studying. Pretty decent bass, better than the other headphones mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound for the price and battery life
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound for the price and battery life, however durability not so good. These lasted around two months before they stop working all the sudden, I assume it has something to do with the so-called Nano coating making these "sweatproof". So, if you're planning on using these for every day listening these are a great bang for the buck, but if you’re planning on doing any kind of sport while using these then my suggestion would be move to another option. Update, After a quick chat with customer support, they agreed to send a new pair free of charge, claiming a faulty product, so I’ll be testing this new pair and reporting back. Awesome customer service as usual.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Another great Anker product
customer_reviews.text: Got these on sale for about $21 and they are fantastic. I've been a fan of Anker for a while and own many of their products such as a gaming mouse and mouse pad, power banks for devices, a Bluetooth keyboard, cables and earbuds. These come with a great selection of parts to customize the fit. The soft rubber ear hooks are separate from the ear pieces that go in the canal. Very comfortable and the sound is decent. The paired with my Pixel phone no problem and my Samsung tablet. Buttons work great. Magnetic feature is a better idea than you might think. Helps while wearing them and when storing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tocsik

customer_reviews.title: Volume too low
customer_reviews.text: Sometines need to try more then once to turn on, And in noisely environents the sound it makes when turning on id hard to hear, compared tonother models Also, forced to use the loudest setting, with other brands, never need to turn it up so high The poistives? Fits well, connection is excellent , and battery life is good, and appears well made But mostly due to thw low volume , i only give 3 stars
customer_reviews.author: paul J

customer_reviews.title: Just bluetooth earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the other stuff I was asked to rate. Noise cancelling? Well, being earbuds they do block out some of the sounds around me. But, at the same time, it's hard to rate a feature that doesn't really exist with the product. Moisture wicking? Well, I sweat with and without these earbuds. They sound very good. I'm sure a $200 pair might be better but these are a very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. Zuehlke

customer_reviews.title: Complete disappointment. They were very comfortable to run in
customer_reviews.text: Less then three months after purchase, there is no sound coming from the left ear piece. Complete disappointment. They were very comfortable to run in, and I used them daily, and coddled them, because I love them so much. Will be looking for a more durable replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MegSoro

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, returned
customer_reviews.text: These were uncomfortable, the sound was just...off. Tinny, very "small speakers" sound, no matter what tips I used or how I put them in, how I tweaked the equalizer. The button toggle was also really heavy. I was really hopeful for these but they were a total bummer. It's not one star because shipping was fast and it's not like they didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Overall, they were what you expect from a lower priced bluetooth in-ear headset meant for activities. The sound quality was average for class, the noise cancellation was what you got from the highest volume level and silicon stuck in your ear, and they survived sweaty workout sessions seemly well until... The left side died. When I say died, I mean one day the they just stopped working. Not from being dropped, or submerged in water, just dead. They are not nearly as durable as you would hope. Now, when music plays, you either hear nothing, or very annoying static that essentially requires keeping the left side out or risk tinnitus and a very distracting workout.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 4hrs/charge & bad connections
customer_reviews.text: The product description states it lasts up to 7 hours. WELL, that's completely wrong. From using it for about 2.5 weeks, from max charge to dead, without turning it off in between, it lasts at most 4 hours. Also if the device you're connected to, in my case, my iphone7, is in your front pants pocket, and you wear a hood, or a scarf, the signal to the anker soundbuds gets completely blocked out, making it sound like your soundbuds are breaking down. Not something I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after losing my BeatsX (RIP) and didn't want to spend $100 on another pair. The call/microphone quality is not great, but the sound quality and battery life far exceeded my expectations for a $20 pair of earbuds. It does not have much noise-cancelling ability, but you get what you pay for, and this is a great (and cheaper) alternative to some more expensive wireless earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: GoDawgs0506

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds sound very nice and are quite comfortable to wear for extended period of time. They don't block out outside noise as well as other earbuds I have. It was easy to pair with my devices. The battery lasted as expected per charge. The one gotcha, hence the minus one star, is the cord. The cord is barely long enough to go around the back of the neck, and it is pretty sticky. When I have these earbuds on and turn my head sideways, the earbuds have a tendency to tug due to the cord sticking to the back of my clothing or neck.
customer_reviews.author: tonys

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones (for the price) but don't last too long
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound for music, perfect sound for podcasts which is mostly what I listen to. These worked great for about 10 months, then started having connections issues. I contacted Anker support and went through the troubleshooting steps and tried to reset the headphones, but the issue wasn't resolved. Anker agreed to replace them under warranty, but the new headphones never arrived. Considering the price I really can't complain that I had some decent headphones for nearly a year, but I'm very disappointed (yet again) in Anker customer service.
customer_reviews.author: ptkdude

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: Love these things! Super confortable. Decent sound quality though. Pros: - Comfortable - Light-weight - Ultra-compact Cons: - Volume level is a little low at it's highest - Battery life is a little less than i would prefer - The sound is a little flat. The highs aren't as crisp as you'd like, and there is a non-existent low. But that's expected for buds. For the price, these are probably the best i have. The cons are very nit-picky details and it comes down to preference. You won't be disappointed in purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: bfresh80

customer_reviews.title: Tin cans on strings work better than these
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Anker's products, so I had reasonable expectations for these headphones. It saddens me to write this review. These headphones are a significant disappointment. In short, these SoundBuds DO NOT WORK. Despite all techy interventions, they do not hold a charge, they do not pair with Bluetooth, and they are essentially destined for electronic recycling (if they qualify) because they cannot even function as a charming paperweight. The magnets on the buds work, so there's a silver lining. I have buyer's remorse that is exasperated by environmental impact guilt. Do not contribute to landfills by purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Very nice headphones. Comes with multiple sized buds for different ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphones. Comes with multiple sized buds for different ear sizes as well as a mini USB charger cable. Overall, these are very easy to control. Syncing with my phone was super easy and turning them on as well. Simply push the middle button and you're good. The controls are on the right side as your headphones hang. Being that I am right handed, this has not been an issue. For the price these have been more than amazing. I generally use these in the gym and they never fall out. Anker is a great brand and these are a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: LonJay

customer_reviews.title: these are great, and anker stands by their warranty
customer_reviews.text: I have bought other anker products, so I expected these to be of good quality. They are- but after about a year, the tiny little screens inside the earbud both came loose. I emailed them and they sent me a replacement pair right away. Very weirdly, the replacement set would not turn on, charge, or work at all. I emailed them and they sent me another replacement right away. Third pair is wonderful. I think its great that Anker stands by their warranty and makes replacements straightforward. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Machaj

customer_reviews.title: Good solid headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are really nice for flying. Not as much noise canceling as some pairs I’ve had but the comfort level in my ear is really good. Also, I do feel like the Anker cord connecting them is tough **Update*** Moving to 5 stars, I have started using these almost daily for everything now that my sales require more time at home. Really do love them
customer_reviews.author: Zweck

customer_reviews.title: Tough stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough great things about Anker and their products. I've purchased their portable phone chargers in the past, and they're still holding up well. My buddy uses their Bluetooth speaker everyday. It sounds really good considering our harsh work environment. I left these Soundbuds in my pants pocket, and wound up throwing them in the wash. It turns out that they were able to withstand a wash cycle, and about an hour in the dryer. Pretty darn good for $25 in my book. I'll be ordering one of their rechargable flashlights in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: tha backwards man

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: It's an overall okay, I was disappointed about the battery life because I literally use my headphones for work and when commuting so I failed to realized a critical part toward looking into headphones was the battery life, it last for about 6 hours max and needs to charge for about 30 mins-1hour which is disappointing if anything because I use my headphones for about 5 hours during work and about 2 hours for commuting and that it eventually doesn't necessarily last me the whole day .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Verified purchase review. WOW!
customer_reviews.text: These buds are the real deal. I searched for the highest rated wireless ear buds and some other brands came up, but were suspect reviews. I’ve purchased products from Anker before and have experienced their awesome customer service so I had no concern ordering from Anker again. Package was great. Pairing was quick Audio quality for music is great Call audio quality is great. These will be stocking stuffers for the family this Christmas. Thank you Anker for being a responsive reputable company and offering a great product at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Scrub175

customer_reviews.title: I have loved these for 19 months
customer_reviews.text: I love these earbuds. I have owned probably a dozen sets of different Bluetooth earbuds and I like these the best. They pair easily, the battery lasts a good solid 6 hours for me, they are lightweight, and best of all, the control section is so thin, it doesn't pull them out of your ear while exercising or working. I'd give these 5 stars but lo and behold, 19 months into ownership exactly, one ear stopped working. Can't say they weren't out of warranty, but still. For essentially a dollar a month, a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: MMMichel

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds for running or sports
customer_reviews.text: I mostly like these headphones a lot. Sound is great, they're durable, they cancel noise fairly well. My main complaint is that the battery life is very deceptive. If it says 60% battery life, go ahead and charge, or else the battery will be dead within 20 minutes. So what it tells you isn't altogether accurate. But overall, these were a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: AOlsson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have "broken" the headphone jack on my phone using regular plug in type. Which ruined the phone which I then had to replace. I have gone through countless plug in headphones over the years with either cassette / disc / mp3 players. So thought I would give this a try. Work very well. I would like them to hold charge for a little longer as I listen to audio books all day long while working. If you remember to turn them off during lunch I can get all work day out of them. If not they quit around 3 - 3:30 in the afternoon. Also work very well to talk on the phone with.
customer_reviews.author: RAS

customer_reviews.title: It fits well in my ears and the design is comfortable enough. The sound quality is just okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 months ago but only started using it within the last 2 weeks so they are practically brand new. It fits well in my ears and the design is comfortable enough. The sound quality is just okay, it's a bit quiet but I knew it wouldn't be the best sound quality given the price. The 1 star is because it's already broken after 3-4 charges. There is a bad static when I'm on a phone call or listening to music. The static comes and goes and it's quite annoying and loud. Maybe I got a defective item. That's very disappointing since Anker has always been reliable with their products before.
customer_reviews.author: ayeo

customer_reviews.title: A Solid "Meh"
customer_reviews.text: These sound all right and don't fall out of my ears while lifting weights or on the elliptical. However, I couldn't imagine them staying in place during bouncier exercise. The controls are annoyingly heavy, and it's a bit difficult to get the cable clip adjusted in such a way that it doesn't pull the right earbud out. UPDATE: Upgrading my review from 3 to 4 stars for Anker's customer service. A rep got in touch with me soon after this review was posted and offered to send me thefree of charge, and those are much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: 8/27/2019 - Product still junk - Anker Customer service Great!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why, but this was the third pair I bought of these. At this point I should've just splurged for nice bluetooth buds. First order was working well then my mother in law washed them. Done. Second set stopped charging so I tried a different brand. No luck. Bought these Anker a third time and now this set won't charge. I've wasted too much money these are crap. Avoid at all costs!!! UPDATE - These earbuds were still trash, but Anker promptly contacted me and rectified the situation. Anker sent me two pairs of the updated model to replace my pairs that broke. SO far the newer model has been great. Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R Prusa

product_meta.title: Bluetooth Headphones, Anker SoundBuds Slim Wireless Headphones, IPX7 Waterproof, 10H Playtime, Bluetooth 5.0, Magnetic Wireless Earbuds, Bluetooth Earbuds for Workout , Sports, Running, Gym
product_meta.description: Color:BlackSoundBuds Slim The Lightweight Earbuds that Defy Sweat and Rain High-Fidelity Audio 6mm drivers deliver crisp, clear music to your ears via a smooth, skip-free connection. Built For Active Lifestyles SoundBuds Slim are designed to be slimline and light (15g), while offering serious performance. Magnetically attach together when not in use, or tuck away into the travel pouch. Customizable Fit Multi-size EarTips and InEar-Hooks provide a sturdy, comfortable hold. Cable measures 55cm for universal fit and no annoying tangles. Adjust your cable length with the FitClip, or affix to your clothing for extra security via the Shirt Clip. IPX7 Waterproof Whether you’re running in the rain, or working up a sweat in the gym, SoundBuds Slim’s waterproof build prevents liquids from damaging the sensitive internal components. Listen Longer Play for up to 10 hours*; longer than most earphones on the market. Bluetooth 5 ensures a connection range of up to 33 ft, compatible with the iPhone 7 or any Bluetooth device. * Up to 10 hours of playtime at 60% volume. Intuitive Control In-built microphone and 3-button remote enable you to manage more conveniently - from skipping a song, to answering a call without touching your phone. Worry-Free Warranty At Anker, we believe in our products. That's why we back them all with an 18-month warranty and provide friendly, easy-to-reach support. Note: If you want to recharge these earbuds after exercising, please follow these steps: 1. Open the port cover and shake to remove any sweat from inside the USB port. 2. Wipe the USB charging port dry with a cotton cloth. 3. Charge with a 5V certified charger and cable. 4. Make sure the port cover is fully closed after charging. *Playtime varies according to volume level and audio content
feature_bullets: Listen Up: Precision engineered 6mm drivers, fed via Bluetooth 5, offer powerful and skip-free audio.
Find Your Fit: Lightweight design with customizable Ear Tips and EarWings give anyone a strong and comfortable fit.
Leading Playtime: Listen for up to 10 hours on a single charge. Enough juice to soundtrack your day.
IPX7 Waterproof: Superior protection against liquids such as rain, sweat, and water.
What's In The Box: SoundBuds Slim, XS/S/M/L Ear Tips, S/M/L EarWings, Fit Clip, Shirt Clip, Micro USB Cable, Travel Pouch, welcome guide, our worry-free 18-month and friendly service.
